C1 a sign of damage to a person's mental state: His early years in the refugee camp left a deep psychological scar.
a sign of physical destruction in a place: Every village bears the scars of war .
More examplesFewer examplesHe had a long scar across his cheek.Her scar healed, but the redness remained for a long time.His face is covered with scar tissue where he was badly burned."Just look at this scar!" said Aaron proudly, rolling up his trouser leg.They did a very neat job stitching up your knee - there's hardly a scar there.
